<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #20480 (Replace boost::variant with std::variant by MarcoFalke)

If you consider this pull request important, please als
can you give a "tutorial" on how to change address on master? I can't seem to figure this out.

@instagibbs : Click "sending addresses" and then right click on an address and then "edit".


![Screenshot from 2020-02-26 00-28-43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6399679/75271563-fd527180-582e-11ea-8c37-af6ba87daeed.png)

Same on master:

![Screenshot from 2020-02-26 00-30-36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6399679/75271821-6b973400-582f-11ea-9d42-75fd6cada8ad

The edit function is already somehow hidden. IMO Having a "address books" without an edit function seems quite limiting. @luke-jr: what would it mean to fix bug1/2?\n\nWould deprecating the address book (then removing it at some point) make sense?
How would you edit labels then?
@MarcoFalke Actually, this was only addressing inline editing, so the dialog is another place to disable the editing... Fixed
@instagibbs I suspect "how to inline edit" is platform-dependent, but on my KDE-based system, double-clicking on the field I intend to edit does it.
NACK sorry.\nI agree with @jonasschnelli, instead of removing it I would improve it
@emilengler What is the use case? Clearly nobody uses it since it doesn't work. @jonasschnelli seems confused about the PR, and isn't NACKing it...
@luke-jr Do you really know that nobody is using it?\nAlso I was agreeing on the reason not on his choice though
It _doesn't work at all_... And hasn't for a long time now. How could anyone be using it?

> It doesn't work at all... 

That's why I said improve it instead of remove it

> How could anyone be using it?

You're right on that point though but maybe some users are frustrated because it didn't worked
FWIW I tend to edit labels by right-clicking on a transaction then doing 'edit label'. Haven't used the address book for ages.\n\nBut as long as it's there it should probably work.
This has no impact whatsoever on the ability to edit labels anywhere.\n\nThis is about when the user attempts to edit the *address*.

<!--cf906140f33d8803c4a75a2196329ecb-->
üêô This pull request conflicts with the target branch and [needs rebase](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#rebasing-changes).

<sub>Want to unsubscribe from rebase notifications on this pull request? Just convert this pull request to a "draft".</sub>
If this is still relevant, it should be rebased and then re-opened in the [gui repo](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pulls).
